title: 111_s167
content: The "COPS Improvements Act of 2009" may be cited as the official title of the Act. It focuses on improving COPS grants. The "COPS Improvements Act of 2009" amends Section 1701 of the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 to authorize the Attorney General to make grants for community policing and crime prevention purposes. The "COPS Improvements Act of 2009" amends Section 1701 of the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 to authorize grants for community policing and crime prevention, including hiring school resource officers and establishing partnerships between law enforcement and schools to address crime, gangs, and drug activities. The "COPS Improvements Act of 2009" authorizes grants for community policing and crime prevention, including innovative programs to reduce illegal drug activities and awarding grants for enhancing community policing. Subsections (c), (h), and (i) are removed, and subsections (d) through (g) are redesignated. The "COPS Improvements Act of 2009" authorizes grants for community policing and crime prevention, including hiring former military members as law enforcement officers in communities affected by military base closings. Grants can also be used for community prosecuting programs. The "COPS Improvements Act of 2009" authorizes grants for community policing and crime prevention, including programs for specific violent crime problems and technology grants for new law enforcement technologies. The Office of Community Oriented Policing Services is designated as the exclusive component of the Department of Justice to perform related functions and activities. The act also includes provisions for retaining additional law enforcement officer positions created under grants for hiring or rehiring career law enforcement officers. The "COPS Improvements Act of 2009" amends Section 1703 of the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 by redesignating paragraphs and striking subsection (d). "SEC. 1703. RENEWAL OF GRANTS." "A grant under this part may be renewed without limitations on duration to provide additional funds if used as required and significant progress is shown. The Attorney General can also extend a grant period to complete objectives. Limitations on fund use are amended." The Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 is amended to allow for enforcement actions instead of revocation or suspension of funding. The Attorney General can take any enforcement action available to the Department of Justice. The Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 is amended to allow for enforcement actions by the Attorney General, instead of revocation or suspension of funding. The Department of Justice can take any enforcement action available. The Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 is amended to authorize enforcement actions by the Attorney General. Definitions for law enforcement officers are updated, and appropriations are increased for fiscal years 2009 through 2014.
